alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near High Falls, or 9 miles northwest of New Paltz, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hurley, Woodstock, Red Hook, High Falls, Tillson, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Port Ewen, Lake Katrine, Staatsburg, Olivebridge, Kerhonkson, Rosendale, Marbletown, Veteran, Tivoli and Centerville. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
